issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: Unless there is a valid configuration where dfs.block.access.token.enable is off and security is on, then rather than shutdown we should just enable the block access tokens.
fields.summary: dfs.block.access.token.enable should default on when security is !simple

comments.body: Attach a simple patch for this. I think it will not affect the main logic in HDFS, the default value only used in {{DataNode#checkSecureConfig}} and {{BlockManager#createBlockTokenSecretManager}}. Thanks for review!

Oh, so if block token access is enabled on an insecure cluster, it doesn't actually do anything?  If so, then let's add that to description in hdfs-site.xml so that admins understand why this is default to true.

Hi, [~aw], the comments that I gave before seemed not correct. I am sorry for that. The dfs.block.access.token.enable default on will let the method {{createBlockTokenSecretManager}} return a new {{BlockTokenSecretManager}} and then it means that BlockToken was enabled in {{BlockManager}}. It will change the existed logic.
